results.title: Uterine and fetal hemodynamics and fetal cardiac function after atenolol and pindolol infusion. A randomized study.
results.journal: Eur J Obstet Gynecol Reprod Biol
results.text_hl: According to our results, @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@ seems to be more preferable in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@pregnancy-induced@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Räsänen J, Jouppila P. Uterine and fetal hemodynamics and fetal cardiac function after atenolol and pindolol infusion. A randomized study. Eur J Obstet Gynecol Reprod Biol. 1995 Oct;62(2):195-201. PMID: 8582495
citations.BibTeX: @article{8582495, title={Uterine and fetal hemodynamics and fetal cardiac function after atenolol and pindolol infusion. A randomized study.}, author={Räsänen J and Jouppila P}, journal={Eur J Obstet Gynecol Reprod Biol}, volume={62}, number={2}, pages={195-201}}

results.title: Beta-blocker subtypes and risk of low birth weight in newborns.
results.text_hl: Exposure to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Labetalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007741 @@@labetalol@@@ were associated with increased risks of infant born small for @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@gestational age@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@SGA@@@) (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@: adjusted OR 2.4, 95% CI: 1.7-3.3; @CHEMICAL_Labetalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007741 @@@labetalol@@@: adjusted OR 2.9, 95% CI: 2.6-3.2).

citations.NLM: Duan L, Ng A, Chen W, Spencer HT, Lee MS. Beta-blocker subtypes and risk of low birth weight in newborns. J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich). 2018 Nov;20(11):1603-1609. PMID: 30267456
citations.BibTeX: @article{30267456, title={Beta-blocker subtypes and risk of low birth weight in newborns.}, author={Duan L and Ng A and Chen W and Spencer HT and Lee MS}, journal={J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich)}, volume={20}, number={11}, pages={1603-1609}}

results.title: Anti-hypertensive drugs in pregnancy and fetal growth: evidence for "pharmacological programming" in the first trimester?
results.text_hl: In addition most of these babies were @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@small for gestational age@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@SGA@@@) with 70% on or below the 10th centile and 40% below the third centile.

citations.NLM: Bayliss H, Churchill D, Beevers M, Beevers DG. Anti-hypertensive drugs in pregnancy and fetal growth: evidence for "pharmacological programming" in the first trimester? Hypertens Pregnancy. 2002;21(2):161-74. PMID: 12175444
